comment: I'm terrible at chemistry so I felt like the homework took me HOURS to do, but I didn't know if that was a Me thing or a professor thing. She was reallllly nice though. Super sweet energy. Accent is a little tough but she's fun to listen to. Her SI carried me through the class, super good too. Class was tough but she was nice

I had a really good experience!! She's very helpful especially in her office hours when you need 1 on 1 to understand the material. She is kind and professional, never rude or condescending. Show up to class and do the homework. Don't expect to get an A without asking questions when you need to and doing the worksheets. VERY generous test grading.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Test heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: I took her chem 1211 summer course, and she did a great job clarifying complex subjects, responding to emails, and making adjustments when needed. I would definitely recommend her.

Don't take her online class. Extremely fast paced. Your first quiz will be due on the second day of school, based on 20 lecture videos. LONG essay-style discussions. Weekly quizzes. Case studies. Difficult exams every 3-4 weeks. Study everything. The textbook on Aleks will be your best friend. Final is in person. Put everything in your calendar.

She's an amazing professor. She provides lots of resources that you can use to study and pass this class like ALEKS homework, study guides, power points, and the textbook. Chemistry in general is a hard and tedious subject so you will have to study and practice on your own outside of class. She responds pretty quickly to emails.

Do not take as an online class. I feel like when I needed help she didn't help me even when I begged her. Do not miss assignments because she will not let you make them up. Aleks homework which is very hard and you will fail the tests if you don't know the material. Not very understanding and not willing to help students when in need.

My Chem 1211L section was instructed by Dr. West's GTA's, she herself used to pop in for a bit and leave. The labs were easy to follow and do and the lab instructors were very helpful and explained each lab really well. the pre and post lab work was done at home, but the instructor was an easy grader. My GTA was Tyler Davis. Overall, very easy lab!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: Take this professor for Gen Chem! She is amazing and will make sure you understand the material. Chemistry is overwhelming in general, and Professor West will help you along the way. Show up to class, do the homework, attend SI sessions, and ask questions. She provides lots of resources. Only downside is that she is hard to reach outside of class.

Dr. West is a very calm, nice professor. She's easy to follow along with. I enjoyed her class a lot. I recommend reading the textbook to supplement her lectures, though, as her PowerPoints are directly drawn from our book. She gives a lot of examples in class, though. She does weekly quizzes, progress checks, and homework, so it is a lot.

This professor was super nice and attentive. Answered all questions well and wanted students to understand. The work is pretty straight forward. Going to lecture is very helpful and she is very eager to help.

There are a lot of studying resources: weekly homeworks, quizzes (progress checks),  extra credit assignments, (optional) textbook readings, and practice exams. The professor shares her lecture notes and sets up a zoom for students unable to attend the lectures in person (although I would encourage being present to better understand the concepts).
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Lecture heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: You have to self teach yourself and I took her over the summer she is amazing! Her office hours help you understand more but overall she is very understanding. She does have an accent and the way she teaches is showing harder ways to do the problems but shes overall an amazing professor.

One of the best professors for this course! She has an accent but she does a good job at explaining things and will go back and answer questions. The homework was a bit tedious but overall she is an amazing professor.

Dr. West is one of the best professors I've had. She is very knowledgeable and is always willing to help students understand the material. I recommend going to her office hours because those help a ton. The tests can be difficult if you don't have a solid understanding of the material but they are not terrible. Overall, she is an amazing professor.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Great lab professor! She was always attentive to her students and gave great feedback. If you ever struggled during a lab, she would sit with you and explain the procedures step by step. She also checked to make sure your data was accurate before turning it into lab flow. The only problem I had with the lab was that lab flow was very tedious.
Good prof who really cares about her students but the material is unnecessarily difficult, and the homework is never ending
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: Chemistry is not an easy course but Dr. West is willing to help you succeed. She wants everyone to do well and  shes very encouraging. Yes there is a lot of work, but it helps you when its time for the test. I would say go to her office hours. They really helped me do well in the class. As long as you put in the effort in chem, you will do well!

Dr. West is a very caring person and loves to help you actually learn. She does have a slight accent, but it is very easy to get past. I got an A in her 1211L and then took her again in 1212 lecture and am on course for an A again. 1212 is 5 tests (1 drop) , 14 quizzes (3 drop), worksheets (participation), reading checks (3 dropped), 1 final.

i understand chem1212 is not the easiest course, but there absolutely is an easier way to learn the material than the way she currently does. don't get me wrong, it's doable work, but you has 50hw questions a week every week (yes even on test weeks) with the majority of it being stuff you have to teach yourself. don't take if you want an easy a.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: She has an accent and it was kind of hard to understand her at first, but as the semester went on, you get used to it. She moves kind of fast, but she's not a bad teacher. She's always willing to answer questions.

Dr. West does her best to help you succeed in Chem lab. The course is not hard, and she guides you very well throughout the labs. Make sure to follow the general chem lab/lab notebook guidelines and submit your assignments in time. I really enjoyed taking the course with Dr. West. She also has a few extra credit opportunities to boost your grade.

She has an accent that can be hard to understand. The tests are ALWAYS easier than the questions on the homework. She gives 2 weekly quizzes/reading checks that are easy but can get annoying. She had class participation as a 6% section, she gave a paper to guide you through her lectures so no need for notes really. Overall, easy class, def take.
